newsitem.title: JAPAN: Typhoon Peter paralyses transport in southern Japa.
newsitem.headline: Typhoon Peter paralyses transport in southern Japa.

text.p: Typhoon Peter, packing winds of 108 kph (67.5 mph), landed on Japan's southernmost main island Kyushu on Saturday, paralysing air and rail traffic.
As of 10.00 a.m. (0100 GMT), Typhoon Peter was storming through Nagasaki, 980 km (600 miles) southwest of Tokyo, the Meteorological Agency said.
Peter, the second typhoon to hit Japan this month, was expected to dump up to 35 cm (14 inches) of rain, the agency said.
The typhoon was moving northeast towards Japan's main island of Honshu at a speed of 35 kph (22 mph), it said.
More than 100 domestic flights were cancelled because of the typhoon, airline companies said.
It was the first time two typhoons have threatened Japan's home islands in June since authorities started to compile data on typhoons in 1951, weather officials said.
Last week, Typhoon Opal killed one person and disrupted air, rail and road traffic when it hit central Japan.
